bibl.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King
The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County, Greeting: United States Marshal

We command you, that you have the body of John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Bowler and McCrinkle shall be called or charged, before the HON. RICHARD A. JONES, Judge of the aforesaid Court at the Court House in the City of Seattle W.T. at the hour of 4 o'clock P.M. of said day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. RICHARD A. JONES, Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 28th day of June A.D. 1888 W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk. By H. T. Hannon Deputy Clerk.
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W.T.
In the Matter of the Application of John Bowler et al. For Writ of Habeas Corpus HABEAS CORPUS
